title: TIMELINE: Severe storms brings risk of hail, tornadoes to Oklahoma on Sunday
text: While some may see some rain on Friday, we have a Red Panel Alert Day on Sunday as severe storms move back into Oklahoma.>> Check live radar | KOCO weather page | Get KOCO on the GoKOCO 5 Meteorologist Jonathan Conder says central Oklahoma, including the OKC metro, to parts of western Oklahoma near Clinton, Hobart and Woodward, have a level-two slight risk for storms on Sunday. The concern will be for damaging winds, hail and a tornado risk.Jonathan says the biggest threat is for 1.75-inch hail and 60 mph winds. He added that the tornado and flooding threat are low.A band stretching from Altus to near the Oklahoma Panhandle as well as southern Oklahoma to Seminole, Bartlesville, Tulsa, McAlester and Durant have a level-one marginal risk.The tornado index is highest in a corridor of western Oklahoma from Lawton to Clinton and Alva. Jonathan says that area is a 4 out of 10 on the tornado index.| MORE | How to personalize, use KOCO 5 app to stay safe during severe weatherThe OKC metro to Enid, Stillwater and Ponca City is a 2 on the tornado index. Southern Oklahoma to Durant, McAlester, Tulsa and Bartlesville as well as far western Oklahoma is listed as a 1.Jonathan says he expects storms to go up and form some supercells that could rotate. By the time the storms hit Interstate 35, Jonathan says they will turn into a line of storms.The KOCO 5 First Alert Weather Team will continue to monitor models as we get closer to Sunday's threat.Jonathan shows when you can expect to see severe storms in your area on Sunday.
